current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide
		  for Congressional oversight and approval of totalization
		  agreements.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following bill; which
			 was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Social Security Totalization
			 Agreement Reform Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited as
			 the

header.#text:
Transmittal and
			 Approval of Totalization Agreements

Section 233(e) of the
			 Social Security Act

text.#text:
Any agreement to
				establish a totalization arrangement which is entered into with another country
				under this section shall enter into force with respect to the United States if
				(and only if)—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

				days before the date on which the

enters into the agreement, notifies
				each House of Congress of the President’s intention to enter into the
				agreement, and promptly thereafter publishes notice of such intention in the
				Federal Register,

transmits the text of
				such agreement to each House of Congress as provided in

,
				and

				law.

text.#text:
A statement of any administrative

A statement describing whether and

				negotiated.

A statement describing how and to

				and objectives of this title.

An assessment of the ability of such
